<<<<<<< HEAD
The antipodes a comedie. Acted in the yeare 1638. by the Queenes Majesties Servants, at Salisbury Court in Fleet-street. The author Richard Brome. Brome, Richard, d. 1652?
[88] p.
Printed by I. Okes, for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shops in Kings-street at the signe of the Goat, and in Westminster-hall, London : 1640.
Signatures: A-L⁴. The verse on A4r signed "Rob. Chamberlain.". Variant: verses signed "R.C.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[88] p.
Printed by I. Okes, for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shops in Kings-street at the signe of the Goat, and in Westminster-hall, London : 1640.
Signatures: A-L⁴. The verse on A4r signed "Rob. Chamberlain.". Variant: verses signed "R.C.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

his shops in Kings-street at the signe of the Goat
